Name: Examining the causes and conditions surrounding HIV/AIDS-related deaths in NYC.
Title: A Local Law in relation to examining the causes and conditions surrounding HIV/AIDS-related deaths in New York City

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Summary: The proposed legislation would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) to conduct a study of all HIV/AIDS-related deaths in the city between 2017 and 2019 to assess the causes and circumstances that lead to each death. The department would submit a report to the Council no later than December 31, 2020, outlining the findings of such study. The goal of this legislation is to understand where existing gaps in HIV/AIDS services exist, and how the City can address these gaps.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. The department of health and mental hygiene shall conduct a study of all HIV/AIDS-related deaths in the city between 2017 and 2019 to assess, where applicable, the causes and circumstances that lead to each death. The department shall submit a report to the speaker of the council no later than December 31, 2020, outlining the findings of such study.  
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 60 days after it becomes law, and is deemed repealed after the submission of the report required pursuant to this local law.
